Articles.Content: Nope, they dont work, because this mod change Sun to Kerbol. you can simple change other mods with notepad (find main kopernicus text files and change Sun to Kerbol). but I tried this mod with new horizons with clouds and my pc burned in hellfire
so seems like theres a bug with the worm hole not sure if anyone else has had this problem but it says hyper jump and then just cuts into empty space

> 
> so seems like theres a bug with the worm hole not sure if anyone else has had this problem but it says hyper jump and then just cuts into empty space

go into the map view and zoom out...

So far, this mod looks really cool, It works ok, but the orbits of the other planet packs now circle the black hole in the centre instead of Kerbol, but that's alright... Kerbins atmosphere looks really cool now too, but there's no light diffraction on kerbin anymore, so theres always stars in the sky, and daytime looks dimly lit at best... I can deal with it for now, I'm running almost 70 mods at the moment though

I've looked through this thread in depth and through several other threads and I am curious about what the current bug situation is for this mod? There isn't an up to date bug thread on the OP that I can see.

I know there was an issue with solar panels but I believe that has been fixed with the hotfix on Kopernicus.

There have also been issues with views in the KSC, but I don't know where that is at.

Also there is an issue with the SOI so that it is impossible to orbit suns?

And finally adding this to an existing save will displace (and promptly destroy probably) crafts currently in flight.

Is there anything else I am missing?

> 
> I've looked through this thread in depth and through several other threads and I am curious about what the current bug situation is for this mod? There isn't an up to date bug thread on the OP that I can see.
> I know there was an issue with solar panels but I believe that has been fixed with the hotfix on Kopernicus.

I mean it's buggy as hell, but I haven't had too many issues with SOI stuff. I'm having issues displaying the textures in the game properly, there's weird clouding effects, sometimes Kerbin is bathed in perpetual starlight, even when kerbol is out. The solar panels are really weird, they seem to work mostly, but also seem to drop power until I load out to the space center and back to the crafts.

Thank you for the info. I think I'll hold out until this is more stable. I really want to make a career mode out of this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Omg... Gargantua system! Finally!!!! ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Time to take the endurance mod out for a test drive!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Maybe some kind of easter egg on mann/edmunds planet of a a lazerus pod? just a suggestion ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) (super exited to try this mod!!!)

Kerbins atmosphere looks really cool now too, but there's no light diffraction on kerbin anymore, so theres always stars in the sky, and daytime looks dimly lit at best... I can deal with it for now, I'm running almost 70 mods at the moment though

I'm running according to AVC 62 mods, outer planets and kerbol + I'd really love to run this mod on top of them that way I have an end game so I could go on the "interstellar" quest. Is there any way to modify the orbit values so I can keep all the planets around kerbol that I currently have along with satilites and probes, if not guess I could start a new game, but when I attempted to add this mod on it cut off from jool and everything outside of jools orbit was thrown into the middle... , would love a work around, this is totally an awesome idea / mod, I just wish I could run it maintaining all the current planet positions of kerbol
This mod looks awesome!! are you looking at releasing the update with 1.0.5? How goes it?

For some reason when running this mod, I cant back out or load a vessel when trying to build vessels.

Help ?

Update: I've tested the mod as the only mod installed and I still get the problem.

Looking forward to a 1.0.5 safe version:)

Hi,I heard this mod transfigured Kerbol into a black hole which has sort of put me off as I thought the mod would be essentially an add-on.  

While I like the idea and,after a little practice,would like to contribute with a gas giant or even micro star (brown dwarf) system orbiting a larger star,I'm wondering if there is a version that doesn't incorporate the black hole/kerbol change  

Thanks for any replies and good luck on the mod

[quote name='DarthJeb']Hi,I heard this mod transfigured Kerbol into a black hole which has sort of put me off as I thought the mod would be essentially an add-on.  

While I like the idea and,after a little practice,would like to contribute with a gas giant or even micro star (brown dwarf) system orbiting a larger star,I'm wondering if there is a version that doesn't incorporate the black hole/kerbol change  

Thanks for any replies and good luck on the mod[/QUOTE]  

I think you misunderstood. The mod aims to create a cluster of local stars. They all need something to orbit, an the most realistic thing would be a black hole. The way KSP works makes it that you can't change the center of the game to something other than the Sun. To deal with this, the stock Sun was made to a black hole, and a new identical Sun called Kerbol was made orbiting that black hole. The stock planets were made to orbit the new Kerbol. The main system is still the same with all the planets orbiting a star called Kerbol.

Are there any updates on this mod? Looks like the last post to the thread was January of this year and it's the end of November now. I'm running zero mods at the moment because most of the ones I enjoyed have turned into actual parts of the game already. What I really would like now is to travel to other star systems, having worked out best practices for long distance space travel within the game. I just want to make sure before I say goodbye to all of my current saves that things are going to work okay. The main concern I have right now besides if this mod will work with the latest updates to the game is that somebody mentioned that all of Jool's moons have been disrupted and I'll need those as I would plan to use them as my final refueling point before leaving the Kerbol system.

It seems that KG2 still works in 1.05 with the new updated version of Kopernicus, but all the stars that were added seem to render as Kerbol, including the black hole(s), when viewed up close.

I'll play around with the settings and update EVE's clouds to see if those will fix/break anything.

I hope there will be an "official" update to this mod, if not I'll see if I can patch it for everyone.

The way KSP works makes it that you can't change the center of the game to something other than the Sun. To deal with this, the stock Sun was made to a black hole, and a new identical Sun called Kerbol was made orbiting that black hole. The stock planets were made to orbit the new Kerbol. The main system is still the same with all the planets orbiting a star called Kerbol.

Thanks for the timely reply,I now understand ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") It is quite cool the way you worked around the game limitations,as I just thought Kerbol had an SOI that had been set to a near infinite number.

Is there a name for the black hole?Somthing like Kagetarus A?

I would like to ask: Was extracting the contents of the fresh download folder into my ksp gamedata folder the right way to instal it? Before i launch KSP, Because last time I download this mod from a link, I did it differently, And had to reinstall KSP - Even after deleting the entire mod, the game was still unplayable, The space center screen was actully JUST the ambiance thats suppose to be there and the galexy backdrop, And i couldnt click any invisable buildings. I will list the items in the KSP gamedata folder here:(in order from top to bottom)

BoulderCo (Folder), EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements (Folder), KerbalGalaxy(Folder), KerbalTek(Folder, this has hyperedit), Kopernicus(Folder), Squad(Folder), ModuleManeger.2.6.7.dll(Application extension) ModuleManager(CONFIGCACHE file) Modulemanager.ConfigSHA(CONFIGSHA file), ModuleManager.Physics(PHYSICS file), ModuleManager.TechTree(TECHTREE file)

The parenthensees shows what the file is acording to the "Type" thing, Its left of "Size", And right of "Date modified" Date modified is right of "Name"

The things that i showed above are inside the gamedata folder. The thing up top looks like this: This PC > Downloads > ksp-win-1-0-5 > Gamedata >

In case this helps, I am using 64 Bit windows 10.

I am using ksp 1-0-5. And the tital of the thred suggests 1-0-2+, Wich should include 1-0-5. I started KSP, And it stopped responding and didnt start responding again when i clicked to resume a game

Then i edited the files and moved the kerbalgalaxy folder into the kopernicus folder, Started ksp up again, This time, It did not stop responding, But the space center was replaced with clouds and a sun graphic the brightens and darkens depending on the day-light cycle

PLEASE help, And please let it be ASAP Or soon at the very least. ):  Y U NO REPLY!!!

Its been overnight now, Absolutly nothing. Worst forum ever. \*facepalm\* Anywho, I tried all the combination I can think of that might work. Guess what? None of them work. It goes one of these 3 ways: The space center is invisable, and the game is unplayable; The game stops responding and doesnt respond again on loading screens; Nothing happens

If you make a mod, MAKE IT WORK DUMBY!!!

I have already offered a solution to upgrade KG2 to 1.0.5 untill the mod author updates the mod.

You **HAVE** **TO** update the **Kopernicus** folder from the mod's version to the latest release.

[https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/releases](https://github.com/Kopernicus/Kopernicus/releases)

Same goes for the **E.V.E.** folder if you want to upgrade the clouds for the planets.

[https://github.com/rbray89/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases](https://github.com/rbray89/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases/tag/EVE-1.05-1)
